verbose_text: Previously, evidence showed that ITPP was able to inhibit the PI3K pathway.22 This mechanism could explain the decrease in OCR induced by ITPP.32, 33 The effect of ITPP in reducing cell OCR was compared with an inhibitor of PI3K, LY294002.29 Both ITPP and LY294002 reduced OCR of 9 L-glioma and rhabdomyosarcoma cell lines with the same timing.29 Interestingly, the fraction of tumor with incrementR1> 0 is highly variable, ranging from less than 50% to almost 100%.
